meanings.definition: A temporary leave of absence from work
meanings.sent1: During the furloughs, employees get time off from their jobs.
meanings.sent2: The company announced furloughs for some staff members due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent3: Taking furloughs can be like a mini-vacation from the office routine.
meanings.sent4: The furloughs felt like a break in the monotonous work schedule.
meanings.sent5: The concept of furloughs is like hitting pause on work responsibilities.

meanings.definition: To grant a temporary leave of absence to someone
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to furloughs some employees to reduce costs.
meanings.sent2: The company will furloughs workers during the slow season.
meanings.sent3: He furloughs his team strategically to manage workload peaks.
meanings.sent4: Furloughs can help balance work-life by providing short breaks.
meanings.sent5: She furloughs employees with care and consideration for their well-being.
